nodes.text: Esme's really unhappy about the test.
I told her not to worry about it. If she has the skills to be a Rogue, what difference does it make? In the real world, you don't get pop quizzes.
Right... if you fail a test in the real world - you don't get a bad grade. You can get killed.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything else to say to Katie.
I can't think of anything I want to say to Katie at the moment.
Hi, I'm Shawn, Shawn O'Conner. So are you the leader of this loser's club? How do I join?
I think you'll have no trouble fitting in with losers, Shawn. I'm Katie MacMichael.
Yes, after all, no one better fits the epithet of 'loser' than you, O'Conner.
So what is this Rogue Class deal? Is this some sort of glorified Thieves' Guild?
This is the Disbarred Bards class, remember? No Rogues or Thieves around this university, or so the Headmaster wants people to believe.
So what's a nice girl like you doing in a loser's class?
Just lucky I guess. At least I'm not some 'nobler than thou' stuck-up Paladin.
Paladins aren't stuck-up. If anything, they tend to be very humble.
So do you always hang out after class here?
This is the practice room. It's what we're supposed to be doing after class - practicing our lessons and working out.

options.text: Ask What Shawn Needs to Know About the School

nodes.text: Any suggestions on what I need to know or do here at the school?
Well, if you want to fit in here, I think you should get cleaned up. You do look like something the cat dragged in.
Furthermore, you smell like something the cat coughed up.
Any suggestions on what I need to know or do here at the school?
Try not to tick off Master von Urwald too much. If you cross Mr. Terk, he will give you demerits. If you cross the Master, no one ever sees you again.
Ever again?
(shrug) At least not here at the school.
I'll see you around, then.
Sure, see you.
If you want to improve your aim, just visualize Sosi's face on the target. Works for me.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Entertain Katie

nodes.text: You know, you'd think Sosi would be smarter than to try to argue with you, Katie. Especially when you're holding a sharp weapon.

options.text: Say Something Polite to Charm Katie

nodes.text: That target looks like it's begging you to hit it, Katie.
It's not the only thing around here that's asking for it.
And yet stabbing you is against the rules.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Annoy Sosi

nodes.text: I think that having Sosi watch you practice is good for you, Katie. You seem to be hitting that target with more force and accuracy when he's around.
So where'd you learn to use a cutlass?
When I was little, my father used to take me out on his ship when it was in port. His men taught me to use the cutlass and the belaying pin.
So you're Katie the Captain's daughter? No wonder you're such a salty lass.
Well, happy stabbing.
I will.
Are you trying to encourage Thomas, or discourage him?
Neither, really. I just don't get why he tries so hard.
If I can't make it in the Disbarred Bards class, then I don't deserve to be at this school. So I'm doing my best to fit in.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Entertain Katie

nodes.text: Clearly Thomas should be encouraged to practice. It makes the rest of us look good.
And we look so good right now!

options.text: Say Something Polite to Support Thomas

nodes.text: Don't discourage Thomas, Katie. Without him, how else would we know when Master von Urwald wants to make cockroaches out of all of us? Someone's gotta translate the Germanish jargon for us.
If I were as bad as you are at throwing things, Thomas, I would have quit trying to throw things days ago. I'm impressed with your stubbornness.
My father always said to do your best at whatever you do. I'm just trying to live up to his standards.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Amuse Katie

nodes.text: They say, "If at first you don't succeed - try, try again."
But in Thomas' case, I guess it's "If after this much practice, you don't succeed - you're doing it wrong."
How did you learn to throw so well?
I'm a woman and I worked in an inn, so I got to be good at defending myself. You get mighty handy at swinging a chair leg or dodging a pinch.
With a thrown mug, I can hit a drunken brawler at fifteen feet.
So does that mean you're a drunk mugger mug chucker?
See you around, I guess.
Yeah, see you later.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Entertain Katie

nodes.text: Do you think that the reason Master von Blowhard teaches Rogues is because he wasn't good enough to be a thief?
Does make you wonder.
I don't know about that. When Blowhard demonstrates something, he's pretty good at it.

options.text: Say Something Polite to Charm Katie

nodes.text: So where did you learn how to fight? You're really very good at it.
I grew up around the sailors from my father's ship. They were happy to teach me how to use a cutlass and use my agility to my advantage.
Would you like me to show you how to practice with your dagger on these dummies? I'll be happy to show you how to get better.
Right. I'm good. I'm better than you are.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Reassure Katie

nodes.text: I think the Master's test wasn't to show off what we learned, but to show off how clever he is.
Yeah, and make the rest of us feel stupid.
Well, I hope he feels clever, because I sure don't.
So why did you come to this school?
After my mother died, my father didn't think it was "appropriate" for me to run the inn by myself, even though I had been doing it for years.
He wanted me to get married. He wanted me leg-shackled to some jerk for the "privilege" of working like a galley slave to keep the inn going!
And he wouldn't let me crew his ship, even though I know the ropes. I'd been begging him forever to let me sail with him. "No, the sea's no place for a woman!"
Women can be warriors and kings and paladins - but my father thinks they can't be sailors or captains. I came here to prove him wrong.
You're doing a great job of it.
I'd better get going.
See you later.
Did the thief wake you up last night too?
Katie can sleep through anything.
Sleeping through the night is a skill. You need it at an inn - it's noisy all the time.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Tease Katie

nodes.text: So you seriously suspected a ghost?
No! But Esme and Thomas suggested that the thief might not be a 'who', so much as a 'what'.
Oh, so you mean it's not a whodunit but a 'boo-dunit?'
That joke was downright ghastly.
You're right. Let's bury it forever.
Is it because you grew up on ships? Does that make you superstitious?
Is it because you grew up in the streets? Does that make you a jerk?

options.text: Say Something Polite to Encourage Katie

nodes.text: The thief will get caught soon if we're all looking for him. Or it.
We could work together on finding him...
Let's treat it like a contest. After all, whoever catches the thief is most likely to win 'Rogue of the Year'.
Let's see who can catch the thief first.
You're on!

options.text: Say Something Clever to Flatter Katie

nodes.text: You're always direct. How would you go about catching the thief?
I'd ambush the thief in the dorm hallway. It's narrow enough that the thief couldn't just run past me, and there's nowhere to go except the bathrooms.
That's a really good plan.
What if they come at you from the other side?
It's not like you have a better plan.
See you later.
Yeah, later.
So you "rope" that the Master will cut you some slack when it comes to climbing?
What can I say? That rope is bad noose.

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Tease Katie

nodes.text: Don't give up trying to climb now. I haven't had a chance to laugh at your attempts.
I get to laugh at you afterward, right?
Of course! Equal opportunity entertainment!
Why don't you show us how it's done and give us some giggles?

options.text: Say Something Polite to Flirt With Katie

nodes.text: If you're overheated from all this exercise, maybe we could go to the courtyard and cool off by the fountain...
Wouldn't that dampen your ardor?
That's why we ardor do it together.
You ardor be careful what you wish for. You'll just get burned.
You go, I'll catch up.
Really???
No.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Amuse Katie

nodes.text: When it comes time to climb, you say "nope to the rope," eh?
Yeah, if I've got to climb, I'll take the stairs.
As your barred Bard roommate would say - Your joke's out of scope, so give up your dumb hope.
I'd better get going.
See you later.
